business.headline: Inside the gig economy: The real cost of your 10-minute deliveriesTen-minute deliveries have become part of everyday life in urban India. What makes that speed possible is rarely part of the conversation. Read on to understand the people, platforms and policies behind it.

Why salaried Indians need a personal finance reset in 2026Rising living costs, changing job patterns and sweeping labour law reforms are urging salaried Indians to rethink how secure their finances really are.

Ban gig work and you don't solve inequality: Eternal CEO Deepinder GoyalEternal founder Deepinder Goyal argued that the gig economy debate is less about wages and more about discomfort with inequality, warning that bans and over-regulation could erase livelihoods instead of fixing systemic gaps.
Sensex closes 573 points higher, Nifty hits fresh high; NTPC up 5%The S&P BSE Sensex added 573.41 points to close at 85,762.01, while the Nifty50 jumped 182 points to end at 26,328.55​​​​​​​.

Cigarettes to cost more from February 1. Here's how new rates will be decidedThe new levies on tobacco and pan masala will be imposed over and above the applicable GST rates. These measures will replace the GST compensation cess, which is currently charged at varying rates on sin products.

Missed the revised ITR filing deadline? Know what happens to tax refundIn most cases, refunds are issued within a few weeks to a few months. Delays may occur due to mismatches in TDS details, bank account validation issues, or cases selected for scrutiny.

ITC shares tumble 4%, down 13% in 2 days: Buy the dip or stay away?The sharp sell-off comes after the finance ministry revised the taxation structure for cigarettes, effective February 1, 2026. Here is all you need to know.

MCX shares crash 80% in early deals, but the fall is not what it seemsMCX shares fell by more than 80% on trading screens on Friday, hitting an intraday low of Rs 2,192 on the BSE. This was compared with Thursday's closing price of Rs 10,988.60.

Devyani International and Sapphire Foods India shares in focus. Here's whyDevyani International shares were trading at Rs 152.80, up Rs 5.37 or 3.64% during the morning session as of 9:39 am. In contrast, Sapphire Foods India shares were trading lower at Rs 253.95, down Rs 8.75 or 3.33%.

Sensex, Nifty open higher driven by auto, metal stocks as FMCG continues to fallThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 172.34 points to 85,360.94, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 44.10 points to 26,190.65 as of 9:26 am.

Gold, silver price today: How have precious metals started 2026?Gold and silver prices moved higher on Friday, recovering part of the losses seen late last week, even as investors looked back at the historic gains these metals delivered through 2025.

Is 10-minute delivery really unsafe? Zomato CEO answers after gig workers strikeWhile delivery services on platforms such as Zomato and Blinkit were largely unaffected on New Year's Eve, questions around whether 10-minute delivery models put pressure on riders gained traction on social media.

If system was unfair...: Deepinder Goyal as Zomato unaffected by gig workers' strikeZomato and its quick-commerce arm Blinkit recorded their highest-ever single-day orders on New Year's Eve, delivering over 75 lakh orders despite a nationwide gig workers' strike. Founder and CEO Deepinder Goyal said such scale shows a system seen as unfair cannot consistently attract or retain workers.

Special Report: India's Economy Faces Trump Tariffs and Trade Impasse Entering 2026In this Special Report, an unidentified speaker analyses the state of the Indian economy as the nation steps into 2026. While highlighting a 'stupendous 2025' marked by major reforms like GST simplification and the Jan Vishwas Bill, the report warns that India enters the new year 'playing on a strong economic pitch, but also on a sticky wicket'. Key challenges identified include the ongoing trade impasse with the US, punitive 'Trump tariffs' of 50%, and a depreciating rupee which breached the 91 mark against the dollar. The programme notes that while GDP growth remains robust at 8%, high food inflation and sluggish job creation persist. With five state elections due in 2026, the report also flags concerns over rising state debts due to populist spending, even as all eyes turn to the upcoming Union Budget in February to restore confidence and boost private investment.

Commercial LPG cylinder price hiked by Rs 111 on New Year, highest since June 2025On New Year's Day, the price of a 19-kg commercial LPG cylinder was increased by Rs 111 — the steepest hike in six months, — with effect from today. The price of a 14.2-kg domestic LPG cylinder, however, remains unchanged.
Sensex, Nifty end lower as ITC, Godfrey Phillipss crash on tobacco cess moveThe S&P BSE Sensex fell 32 points to close at 85,188.60, while the NSE Nifty50 was up by 16.95 points to end at 26,146.55.

Silver vs gold vs stock vs real estate: What can deliver most gains in 2026Should it be gold, which has just seen its strongest year since 1979? Or silver, which has surged over 150%, marking one of its best-ever annual performances?

Inside draft labour code rules. What the fine print says on wages, working hoursThe draft Rules relate to the Code on Wages, the Code on Social Security, the Industrial Relations Code and the Code on Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions.

ITC, Godfrey Phillips shares tank up to 16%: Why are tobacco shares falling todayShares of Godfrey Phillips India Ltd fell sharply in early trade, sliding nearly 16%. Shares of ITC Ltd also came under pressure, falling around 9% during early trade. The stock slipped to about Rs 362.70, touching its 52-week low.
Sensex opens 180 points higher, Nifty above 26,150; ITC down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 104.21 points to 85,324.81, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 28.60 points to 26,158.20 as of 9:25 am.

entertainment.headline: A Thank You note to Stranger Things: For the journey, friendships, and the feels Netflix's hit series Stranger Things might have come to a close, leaving audiences in splits – emotionally and critically – but its impact endures, immortalising its characters in the hearts of millions of fans.

Ikkis Box Office Day 3: Agastya Nanda film sees uptick, sights Rs 20 crore globally Agastya Nanda and Dharmendra's war drama Ikkis, directed by Sriram Raghavan, saw a slight increase in its day three box office numbers, bringing its Indian net total to Rs 15.15 crore and approaching Rs 20 crore worldwide.

Dhurandhar box office Day 30: Film picks pace again, nears Rs 800 crore in India Dhurandhar, starring Ranveer Singh and directed by Aditya Dhar, has become the highest-grossing Hindi film globally, maintaining strong box office numbers into its fifth week and accumulating Rs 759.5 crore domestically.

The Raja Saab to Jailer 2: Top 10 South Indian films to watch in 2026 A look at the most awaited South Indian films of 2026, spanning sequels, fresh genres, and star-studded ensembles, with release dates, directors, cast, and synopses for each entry.

Deepika and Ranveer's NBA date night in New York City leaves desi fans star-struck Ranveer Singh and Deepika Padukone's courtside appearance at an NBA game thrilled Indian fans and turned the match into a Bollywood-meets-basketball moment. Fans shared their star-struck moment online.

Ranveer's Dhurandhar 2 vs Ranbir's Ramayana 1: Bollywood game of thrones for 2026 In 2026, Ranveer Singh's Dhurandhar Part 2 and Ranbir Kapoor's Ramayana Part 1 could kick off the first real generational power shift for Bollywood in years.

Sara Ali Khan shares snowy vacation pics after New Year celebration: Aisi Jannat Sara Ali Khan shared glimpses from her peaceful winter vacation after celebrating New Year at the Pataudi Palace, posting candid moments with family and snow-filled views.

Archana Puran makes divorce joke during London trip, leaves Parmeet Sethi laughing Archana Puran Singh jokingly spoke about divorcing Parmeet Sethi during their London New Year trip after his "dad joke" left her unimpressed, a moment that became the highlight of her latest family vlog.

BLACKPINK's Jisoo turns 31: Rose, Lisa and Jennie share rare pics to celebrate BLACKPINK's Jisoo celebrated her 31st birthday with heartfelt wishes and unseen photos shared by Rosé, Lisa and Jennie on social media.

Shakti Kapoor recalls parents' reaction to his villain roles: They scolded me Shakti Kapoor shared that his parents were so disturbed by his early villain roles that they walked out of the theatre and scolded him for choosing such characters.

Haq on OTT has seen a truly overwhelming response: Director Suparn Varma Haq Suparn S Varma has expressed his excitement over the overwhelming response the film is receiving after its Netflix release.

Dhurandhar's Rakesh Bedi on why Akshaye Khanna's villain is more loved than the hero Rakesh Bedi has praised Akshaye Khanna's performance in Dhurandhar, saying his quiet nature and lovable villain role made a strong impact on audiences.

Salman Khan's nephew Ayaan Agnihotri gets engaged to Tina Rijhwani, shares pics Salman Khan's nephew Ayaan Agnihotri has announced his engagement to girlfriend Tina Rijhwani, sharing dreamy proposal photos on social media.

Anil Kapoor buys copyrights for Nayak; 2001 film may get sequel: Report Anil Kapoor has reportedly bought the rights to his 2001 cult film Nayak and is keen on producing a sequel nearly 25 years after its release.

Jana Nayagan trailer out: Vijay's farewell film high on mass appeal, politics Makers unveiled the trailer of Vijay's Jana Nayagan. The 2-minute, 52-second trailer offers the first clear look at Vijay's farewell film, even as speculation continues over its links to Bhagavanth Kesari.

Govinda's niece recalls 2024 shooting incident, says there were 200 cops at hospital Govinda's niece, Ragini Khanna, has recounted the 2024 incident when the actor accidentally shot himself, revealing that there were 200 cops at the hospital and 50 outside his home.

KJo to return with family drama in the lines of Kabhi Khushi Kabhie Gham: Report Karan Johar is reportedly set to return to the director's chair in 2026 with his eighth film, a large-scale family drama backed by Dharma Productions.

Suriya and Jyotika praise Dhurandhar, call Ranveer Singh starrer a masterpiece Dhurandhar has received strong praise from Suriya and Jyotika, with the actor calling the film a "masterpiece" and applauding director Aditya Dhar and the cast.

Ashish Vidyarthi, wife Rupali injured in road accident, actor shares update Veteran actor Ashish Vidyarthi and his wife Rupali Barua suffered minor injuries in a late-night accident in Guwahati. Vidyarthi addressed concerns on social media, confirming both are safe and under medical care.

general news.headline: Live: Captured Maduro seen handcuffed after landing in New York, to face chargesVenezuela Attack Live Updates: President Donald Trump said the US would "run" Venezuela for the time being following overnight US strikes that led to the capture of Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro. Earlier, Trump shared a picture of a handcuffed and blindfolded Maduro aboard a US warship that was heading towards New York to face a criminal trial. Several countries, including those in Latin America, Europe, Russia and China condemned US's strikes on Venezuela and called for de-escalation of tensions. The strikes in Venezuela come amid heightened pressure from the US, which has recently targeted alleged drug-smuggling boats, even as Caracas signalled openness to talks on counter-narcotics cooperation. Follow indiatoday.in for live updates.

Venezuela's Maduro caught, Trump warns Cuba, Mexico and Colombia could be nextThe US launched airstrikes on Caracas, captured Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro and his wife Cilia Flores, flew them to the US citing narco-terrorism charges, and claimed Maduro's removal from power.

Drones, blowtorches and sheer luck: How US forces captured MaduroUS officials detailed Operation Absolute Resolve, a months-long planned night raid involving massive airpower that led to the swift capture of Venezuela's President Nicolás Maduro and his wife in Caracas.

US knows what to do next: Did Zelenskyy ask Trump to capture Putin like Maduro?Volodymyr Zelenskyy, without naming Vladimir Putin or Russia, suggested the United States should deal with other 'dictators' as it did with Venezuela President Nicolas Maduro.

Paisa-wasool mentality turning Indian holidays into headachesTravel is meant to be an escape from the mundane of daily life — a chance to relax, unwind, and return rejuvenated. For many Indians, however, holidays often turn into checklist-driven exercises, leaving people to return home not refreshed, but anxious and exhausted.

Video: Handcuffed Maduro in US drug agency office, wishes 'Happy New Year'Captured Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro is seen inside a US drug agency office in the United States, where he briefly addresses the camera and wishes viewers a "Happy New Year," in footage recorded after his detention.

Act of war: Zohran Mamdani dials Trump, opposes Maduro's captureNew York Mayor Zohran Mamdani called Donald Trump and condemned the US capture of Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro as an "act of war".

Delcy Rodriguez appointed Venezuela Interim President day after Maduro's captureThe Constitutional Chamber of Venezuela's Supreme Court has appointed Vice President Delcy Rodriguez, 56, Interim President in the absence of Nicolas Maduro, who was captured by US forces from Caracas.

Inside the gig economy: The real cost of your 10-minute deliveriesTen-minute deliveries have become part of everyday life in urban India. What makes that speed possible is rarely part of the conversation. Read on to understand the people, platforms and policies behind it.

Ranveer's Dhurandhar 2 vs Ranbir's Ramayana 1: Bollywood game of thrones for 2026In 2026, Ranveer Singh's Dhurandhar Part 2 and Ranbir Kapoor's Ramayana Part 1 could kick off the first real generational power shift for Bollywood in years.

Civilians among 40 killed in US military strikes on Venezuela: ReportThe United States launched an airstrike in Venezuela's Caracas early on Saturday to nab Nicolás Maduro. The strike has killed 40 people, including civilians and military personnel, as reported by The New York Times.

Hour of freedom has arrived: Nobel winner Machado praises Maduro's capture by USNobel laureate Maria Corina Machado welcomed US intervention in Venezuela, urged supporters to stay mobilised for a transition of power, and called on the armed forces to recognise opposition leader Edmundo González Urrutia.

India Today @ 50 Part 4: A decade that rewired politics, power and public moodIndia Today @ 50 episode 2 covers a turbulent decade marked by UPA rule, terror attacks, corruption scandals, economic shifts, public protests and the political rise of Narendra Modi-led BJP.
Why the new year makes you want to throw everything outHas the New Year suddenly made you want to declutter everything around you? It's not random; there's a psychological reason behind it.

Now, contaminated water scare in Gandhinagar as over 100 fall sick in a weekOver 100 suspected typhoid cases have been reported in Gandhinagar in the past five days, with most patients undergoing treatment at the Civil Hospital. Authorities have launched health surveys after contaminated drinking water was found in affected areas.

Ready to talk: What Nicolas Maduro told US in his last interview before arrestNicolas Maduro's final TV interview before his capture showed him signalling openness to US talks on drugs and oil, a rare shift in tone toward Washington.

These Indians studied at Harvard 100 years ago, long before studying abroad became a thingThe Kosambi family were among the earliest Indians to study and teach at Harvard University. Their journey highlights challenges faced and contributions made to global education and Indian historiography.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Why did US attack Venezuela? Inside the long road to Maduro's captureThe US strike on Venezuela that led to President Nicolás Maduro's capture did not happen overnight. It was the climax of years of confrontation over power, oil, elections and alleged criminal activity — tensions that finally tipped into military action.

Mustafizur Rahman breaks silence after being released by Kolkata Knight RidersKolkata Knight Riders have released Bangladesh pacer Mustafizur Rahman ahead of IPL 2026, following a directive from the BCCI prompted by political and social backlash surrounding his inclusion.

Why salaried Indians need a personal finance reset in 2026Rising living costs, changing job patterns and sweeping labour law reforms are urging salaried Indians to rethink how secure their finances really are.

Italy comes to India: The hill station designed like a European townA planned city which is also a hill station near Pune is called the 'Italy of India' for its deliberate European‑inspired design. Its pastel facades, lakeside promenade and walkable boulevards echo the charm of Italian towns.

Lady Macbeth: Who's Maduro's powerful wife, a TV star with narco links?Nicknamed 'Lady Macbeth' for her ambition and influence, Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro's wife, Cilia Flores, has long been seen as the power behind the regime in Caracas. With the US capturing Maduro and Flores, her journey from lawyer and TV figure to a part of a narco-terrorism case is under global scrutiny.

After Mustafizur IPL exit, Bangladesh wants its T20 World Cup games out of IndiaThe Bangladesh government has directed its cricket board to approach the ICC over getting their T20 World Cup games outside of India. The move comes after the BCCI asked KKR to release Mustafizur Rahman from the Indian Premier League.

sports.headline: ISL return explained: How Indian football's return from the dead might look The Indian Super League is finally set to return for the 2025–26 season after months of uncertainty. With finances in focus, AIFF is weighing two formats to ensure the league survives before it thrives again.

BCCI hasn't done anything wrong: Former India captain on Mustafizur Rahman issue Former India captain Mohammed Azharuddin praised BCCI for its swift action in dropping Mustafizur Rahman from IPL 2026. The decision has sparked tensions, with Bangladesh seeking to move its T20 World Cup matches out of India.

After rewriting Indian sprinting in 2025, Animesh Kujur wants more Animesh Kujur found his breakthrough in 2025. The 22-year-old became fastest sprinter in India, found incredible fame and is now ready to lead India's sprinting charge in the 2026 Asian Games.

Declan Rice is one of the best: Mikel Arteta praises Arsenal star in Bournemouth win Declan Rice delivered another statement performance as Arsenal beat Bournemouth 3–2. Mikel Arteta hailed the midfielder as one of the world's best, praising his influence, growth and match-winning impact in a crucial title push.

Mohammed Shami's comeback doors to team India still open: Irfan Pathan Irfan Pathan believes Mohammed Shami still has a chance to return to the Indian cricket team, despite not playing international cricket since March 2025. Shami has been toiling hard in domestic cricket, having bowled over 200 overs in the ongoing season.

Ruturaj Gaikwad over Rishabh Pant vs NZ was a straight decision: R Ashwin R Ashwin believes India missed a straightforward selection call by leaving out Ruturaj Gaikwad. With form and balance in his favour, Ashwin feels Gaikwad deserved the ODI spot ahead of Rishabh Pant.

Watch: SCG pays special tribute to Bondi attack vctims ahead of final Ashes Test Cricket paused at the Sydney Cricket Ground as the Ashes made space for remembrance. Victims of the Bondi attack and the heroes who saved lives were honoured in a powerful pre-match tribute.

BCCI turns a blind eye to VHT form: Pant's role in ODIs, Gaikwad's snub a mystery India's ODI squad for the New Zealand series raises questions, with Gaikwad and domestic performers overlooked, Pant's role unclear, and key selection calls once again putting the BCCI's intent under the spotlight.

Vaibhav Suryavanshi gets lucky break, India-U19 beat South Africa by 26 runs via DLS India U19 overcame early setbacks and adverse weather to defeat South Africa by 25 runs via the DLS method in the first Youth ODI. Harvansh Pangalia and RS Ambrish's crucial partnership laid the foundation, while South Africa's chase was interrupted by lightning.

ISL return confirmed: Indian football body to announce start date next week AIFF's confirmation that the ISL will go ahead ends weeks of uncertainty, but questions remain over fees, format and club finances as the federation races to finalise plans for the delayed 2025–26 season.

After Mustafizur IPL exit, Bangladesh wants its T20 World Cup games out of IndiaThe Bangladesh government has directed its cricket board to approach the ICC over getting their T20 World Cup games outside of India. The move comes after the BCCI asked KKR to release Mustafizur Rahman from the Indian Premier League.

Damien Martyn's family issues statement on Australia legend's meningitis battleDamien Martyn's family has issued a statement on the Australian legend's health after his battle with meningitis. Martyn was put in an induced coma after his condition worsened on Boxing Day.

Rishabh Pant, Nitish Reddy roles questioned by ex-cricketer ahead of IND vs NZFormer cricketer Aakash Chopra questioned the roles of Rishabh Pant and Nitish Kumar Reddy in the Indian squad ahead of the New Zealand series. India will play three ODIs against New Zealand, starting from January 11.

India's Bangladesh tour to be put on hold amidst Mustafizur Rahman controversy: ReportFollowing Mustafizur Rahman's exit from the IPL, the BCCI are planning to put India's tour of Bangladesh on hold. India were scheduled to travel to Bangladesh in September this year and the schedule was revealed by Bangladesh cricket board on January 2.

Swiatek on Kyrgios vs Sabalenka: There's no need for Battle of the SexesTennis star Iga Swiatek is not a fan of 'Battle of the Sexes'. Reacting to the intergender match between Nick Kyrgios and Aryna Sabalenka, Swiatek said that the game did not do anything for tennis.

Mustafizur Rahman breaks silence after being released by Kolkata Knight RidersKolkata Knight Riders have released Bangladesh pacer Mustafizur Rahman ahead of IPL 2026, following a directive from the BCCI prompted by political and social backlash surrounding his inclusion.

Neeraj Chopra taking break, recovering from injuries ahead of Asian GamesIndia's star javelin thrower Neeraj Chopra is currently focusing on his rehabilitation, revealed Athletics Federation of India spokesperson Adille Sumariwalla. He revealed that Neeraj's poor show in last year's world championships was due to two injuries.

What more can he do? Mohammed Shami's coach lashes out at Agarkar after ODI snubIndia's ODI squad vs New Zealand: Mohammed Shami was snubbed from the Indian ODI squad once again. Despite showing good form, the selectors decided to not include the fast bowler in the Indian ODI squad against New Zealand.

New Zealand pacer Lockie Ferguson doubtful for T20 World Cup after injury setbackNew Zealand fast bowler Lockie Ferguson faces a race against time to be fit for the ICC Men's T20 World Cup after a calf injury forced him to withdraw from franchise commitments, disrupting his build-up and casting doubt over his readiness for the global tournament.

Gerhard Erasmus to lead young Namibia side during T20 World Cup 2026Namibia has announced a 15-member squad for the men's T20 World Cup to be held in India and Sri Lanka in February–March next year. The team, led by Gerhard Erasmus and supported by consultant Gary Kirsten, features a blend of experienced players and emerging talent, and faces a group including India, Pakistan, Netherlands, and USA.

David Warner goes past Rohit Sharma, equals Virat Kohli after unbeaten ton in BBLDavid Warner smashed an unbeaten 130 in the BBL to move past Rohit Sharma and draw level with Virat Kohli on nine T20 centuries, producing the highest score of the season for Sydney Thunder.

Mohammed Shami ignored again as pacer misses out on India vs New Zealand seriesDespite his fine and consistent form on the domestic circuit, Mohammed Shami has been ignored again by the BCCI for the Indian squad for the upcoming three-match ODI series against New Zealand.

Shashi Tharoor slams BCCI after KKR releases Mustafizur Rahman from IPLKolkata Knight Riders terminated Mustafizur Rahman's contract ahead of the IPL 2026 season, a decision that drew sharp criticism from Congress MP Shashi Tharoor. He hit out at the BCCI over the move.

BCCI Drops Mustafizur Rahman from KKR Squad Amid Anti-Hindu Violence in BangladeshIn a major development ahead of IPL 2026, the BCCI has instructed the Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) to release Bangladeshi pacer Mustafizur Rahman from their squad. BCCI Secretary Devajit Saikia confirmed the directive, citing 'recent developments' and the ongoing anti-Hindu violence in Bangladesh. The decision follows a political storm where BJP leader Sangeet Som called KKR owner Shah Rukh Khan a 'traitor' for buying the player during the auction. The bulletin also covers the upcoming squad announcement for the India vs New Zealand ODI series.

Shreyas Iyer, Mohammed Siraj return as India name squad for New Zealand ODIsIndia vs New Zealand: Captain Shubman Gill and vice-captain Shreyas Iyer have returned to the ODI setup as India announced their 15-man squad for the three-match ODI series against New Zealand.

Steve Smith shares retirement plans ahead of fifth Ashes Test in SydneyAustralia's stand-in captain Steve Smith has opened up on his retirement plans ahead of the fifth Test of the Ashes 2025-26 in Sydney. Smith also reflected on his recent batting form and his evolving role as a senior figure within the squad.

Ashes: Ben Stokes issues stark warning to England teammates ahead of final TestEngland captain Ben Stokes has urged unity and selflessness within his squad ahead of the final Ashes Test at the Sydney Cricket Ground, calling on players to place the team's interests above individual ambitions as the series draws to a close.

Glenn Maxwell as wicketkeeper in T20 World Cup? Australia chief selector reactsAustralia chief selector George Bailey has hinted that Glenn Maxwell could act as a reserve wicketkeeper for Australia during the T20 World Cup 2026. Maxwell has never donned the gloves during his international career for Australia.

Sanju Samson makes case for ODI call-up, slams century vs Ishan Kishan's JharkhandSanju Samson makes a strong case for a call-up in India's ODI side with a century in the Vijay Hazare Trophy fixture against Jharkhand.

BCCI Secretary Devjit Saikia Confirms Directive Asking KKR To Drop Bangladeshi Pacer Mustafizur RahmanBCCI Secretary Devjit Saikia has confirmed that the board instructed Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) to release Bangladeshi pacer Mustafizur Rahman from their squad. Speaking to India Today, Saikia cited 'recent developments' and diplomatic tensions as the primary reasons for the directive, assuring the franchise that a replacement player would be permitted. The bulletin features comprehensive analysis from Sports Editor Vikrant Gupta, who terms the decision a 'corrective measure' following public outrage and backlash against KKR co-owner Shah Rukh Khan. Additionally, political leaders Sangeet Som and Anand Dubey express support for the move, highlighting national sentiments and the safety of Hindus in Bangladesh. Former cricketer Madan Lal also weighs in, stating that while politics in sports is unfortunate, national interests must come first.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
